body: Thanks, marking accepted. PRs are welcome!

Maybe it's related to this place.
https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/069aa680c78b8516b9a1b568519f1d01e74fb2a2/lib/rules/object-shorthand.js#L259-L262

@shulaoda Yes, but this particular part of code is handling function expressions only. The identifiers are handled here: https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/069aa680c78b8516b9a1b568519f1d01e74fb2a2/lib/rules/object-shorthand.js#L493-L516

I can make a PR later this weekend.

issue.title: `object-shorthand`: Port and improve from eslint

repository.name: eslint-stylistic
repository.description: Monorepo for ESLint Stylistic plugins and configs

issue.body:
### Clear and concise description of the problem

According to [this issue](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/18694), `object-shorthand` is deemed as a stylistic rule and as "frozen", so no further feature requests will be accepted for it.

Therefore, here's my feature request for it in this repo:

```js
const object = {
  property: /** @type {const} */ (property)
};
```

In the above snippet, `object-shorthand` will error because key and values could be shortened. Fortunately, eslint won't try to autofix this, due to this PR: https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/18441.

However, the error itself is still here.

### Suggested solution

Port this rule and add a boolean option called `ignoreComments` or more precisely but weirdly sounding `ignoreCommented`. If set to `true`, cases like the above should just be ignored. In my opinion, this should be `true` by default in the next major release.

### Alternative

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Validations

- [X] Follow our [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/eslint-stylistic/eslint-stylistic/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
- [X] Read the [Contributing Guide](https://eslint.style/contribute/guide).
- [X] Check that there isn't already an issue that request the same feature to avoid creating a duplicate.

### Contributes

- [ ] If this feature request is accepted, I am willing to submit a PR to fix this issue
